answers.author: Michael Kirk
answers.text:
Can you provide me with more information? I use to work for developers and have converted the use of different property. Also, where are you located?


Can you provide me with more information? I use to work for developers and have converted the use of different property. Also, where are you located?


Save Changes
Cancel

answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Hello Andre,
I looked around a bit and found some articles on the internet detailing different ways golf courses have been repurposed in recent years.  
Golf courses have been repurposed into:
-Parks with hiking and biking trails
-Sports Fields
-Disc Golf Gardens
-Public Parks
-Ski/Sled Locations
-Amphitheaters
-Farmer's Markets
-Equestrian Centers
-Shooting/Hunting/Fishing Facilities/Habitats
-Public Farms
-Composting Facilities
-Rain Gardens
-Concert Venues
-Green Cemetaries
-Aquifer Recharge Facilities
-Archery Ranges
Take a look at these articles for ideas:
http://www.landthink.com/reclaiming-golf-courses/
http://www.utne.com/Wild-Green/Taking-Back-the-Fairways-for-Parks.aspx
http://www.governing.com/topics/energy-env/Turning-Golf-Courses-into.html
Hope this helps.
Gabe Brehm
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

author: Andre Stigall
text: We are searching for creative options to reprogram an abandoned golf course. What types of uses are out there for consideration? We are interested in hearing any success stories, suggestions, etc. Thank you.
title: Reprogramming an Abandoned Golf Course
